snippet: Lawmakers rejected the Justice Department nomination of Debo P. Adegbile, who was associated with the defense of Mumia Abu-Jamal decades after his conviction in the killing of a police officer.
abstract: Senate Democrats reject Debo P Adegbile, Pres Obama's nominee to lead the Justice Dept's Civil Rights Division, in an embarrassing rebuke of the president; vote leaves senior White House officials angry with members of their own party.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers rejected the Justice Department nomination of Debo P. Adegbile, who was associated with the defense of Mumia Abu-Jamal decades after his conviction in the killing of a police officer.

headline.main: Democrats in Senate Reject Pick by Obama
headline.print_headline: Democrats in Senate Reject Pick by Obama
